events.name: Friday Hacks #126: Realtime Comms & Cross Site Scripting
events.description:
Hey folks, welcome back from the CNY break! Come join us this Friday to learn about computer security and collaborative tools! We will have Jethro Kuan sharing about collaborative text editing and Wang Leng sharing about cross site scripting. Read on to know more.

Date/Time: Friday, February 3 at 6:30pm 
Venue: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, NUS
Free pizza is served before the talks!

Talk 1: Realtime Communication: A Brief History

Talk Description:

We'll walk through the process and difficulties of creating a collaborative text editor. Several problematic solutions will be presented, followed by a brief overview of the current state-of-the-art tools.

Speaker Profile:

Jethro is a Hackers coreteam member and a Year 1 Computer Science undergraduate, who hacks all things hackable.

Talk 2: Cross Site Scripting

Talk Description:

An innocent looking textbox/URL can become a tool for a malicious attacker.

What is a XSS (cross site scripting) attack and how is it executed?
What are the potential dangers and what can be done to prevent such an attack?

Speaker Profile:

Wang Leng is a Year 2 Computer Science undergraduate with a focus area in computer security.

Our Sponsors:

Friday Hacks is sponsored by NUS Enterprise.
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, NUS, , Singapore

events.name: TGIFHacks #60 - Intro to Online Payments (Stripe)
events.description:
This is our 60th TGIFHacks! #achievementunlocked

This week, we have invited Stripe to talk about their online payment system. Come join Stripe for pizzas & an informal chat about integrating payments into your websites and apps. We will also discuss the payments industry, Stripe's approach to developer experience and open opportunities at Stripe in Singapore.
events.location: The Nest Theatre @ Innovation Centre, , Singapore 63
